content: in stockinette stitch knit every row for p2tog purl two stitches together at least 1½ inches to measure unroll the cuff and ssk slip one stitch knitwise slip the next measure from the cast on edge this may seem stitch purlwise knit slipped stitches together long for a baby sock but since little wiggly baby feet tend to kick off short socks i recommend a rs right side longer cuff ws- wrong side move on to heel flap rose city rollers le orangeknitsdesigns 2 heel flap knit across the first 16 18 20 22 24 26 stitches these will be the instep top of foot stitches they will not be worked again until the heel flap and heel turn are done the next 16 18 20 22 24 26 stitches are the heel stitches you will be working back and forth across these stitches for the heel turn and heel flap sections row 1- rs sl1 k1 across heel stitches end with a knit stitch turn row 2- ws sl the first stitch p across stitches turn repeat row 1 & 2 until you have worked a total of 16 18 20 22 24 26 row end with a purl row if you re like me and have trouble remembering to use a row counter you can count the line of slipped stitches the slipped stitches will be raised on the knit side of the heel flap there should be 8 9 10 11 12 13 slipped stitches sometimes i put a removable stitch marker or a progress keeper on one of the slipped stitches in the first row so i know where to start counting heel turn for the heel turn you will be working short row and some people get intimidated by short row if you are one of those people just remember that essentially all you re doing is knitting or purling and turning before you get to the end of the row that s it totally not scary row 1- rs sl1 k8 9 10 12 13 14 ssk k1 turn row 2- ws sl1 p3 3 3 5 5 5 p2tog p1 turn row 3- sl1 k4 4 4 6 6 6 ssk k1 turn row 4- sl1 p5 5 5 7 7 7 p2tog p1 turn you are now working in this pattern- sl1 k or p to one stitch before the gap created by turning in previous row ssk or p2tog to close the gap k1 or p1 turn continue in this pattern until all stitches have been worked depending on what size you are making you might end with just a p2tog and not a p2tog p1 ending with a purl row turn to the right side you should have 10 10 12 14 14 16 stitches remaining move on to the gusset section gusset for the gusset you will be picking up stitches along both sides of the heel flap there are many different methods for picking up gusset stitches some
